intro: Acinodendron ligustroides, commonly known as the African coffee tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that enclose a single seed, which is used in traditional medicine. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
